title: Reddit
cleaned_text: subreddit for all things related to tabletop roleplaying games When a 1st Level Mage can spend a few hours curing the entire village, what happens to local physicians? How do you overcome this world-building obstacle? Do you still have physicians in your towns? Which systems balance this well? Maybe the lack of medical sciences explains the derth of scientific progress, thus the medieval-technological languor. EDIT: I way overstated the case. 2nd and 3rd Ed DnD mages aren't so powerful in the first few levels. I'm looking into Dragon Age RPG and damnit if the mages aren't overpowered. As a non-magic player, I'm a little sensitive to the (sometimes) abundance of magical characters.
